meanings.definition: The act of uniting or joining together.
meanings.sent1: The enosis of the puzzle pieces created a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent2: The enosis of the two rivers formed a larger, stronger stream.
meanings.sent3: The enosis of the ingredients in the recipe made a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The enosis of voices in the choir produced a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The enosis of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: A political movement advocating the union of a region with another political entity.
meanings.sent1: The enosis of the citizens led to a stronger voice in the government.
meanings.sent2: The enosis of the two parties resulted in a new alliance.
meanings.sent3: The enosis of the students in the school council brought about positive changes.
meanings.sent4: The enosis of ideas between the leaders improved the country's policies.
meanings.sent5: The enosis of communities helped in achieving common goals.

meanings.definition: The state of being united or joined together.
meanings.sent1: The enosis of the family members during the holidays was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The enosis of the team players led to victory in the championship.
meanings.sent3: The enosis of flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The enosis of cultures in the city made it a diverse and vibrant place.
meanings.sent5: The enosis of thoughts and emotions strengthened their bond.
